results.description:
Who are we?

Welcome to Vinterior, the new home of vintage. We think there‚Äôs a better alternative to brand new ‚Äì our purpose is to champion vintage for a more characterful and sustainable world.

Vinterior launched in 2016 with 12 London dealers and 200 mid-century furniture pieces. In five years, we‚Äôve grown to 1,800 vintage sellers across Europe, listing 200,000+ products across 97 furniture and homeware categories and generating over $600 million in sales worldwide.

After growing 120% in 2020, we‚Äôve become the leading vintage marketplace in the UK. And we‚Äôre not stopping there. We‚Äôve raised a $10m Series A to accelerate growth and expand into new markets, with the mission to become the #1 vintage platform in Europe by love and scale.

About the Product team:

Vinterior comprises a team of 43, including 7 in engineering and 5 in Product (3 PMs, 1 Product designer and 1 Product analyst)

We currently have 2 cross-functional squads, growing into 3 squads, plus a varying number of stakeholders, and we‚Äôre looking to hire an experienced Product designer to support 1 or 2 of our squads. The team with a diverse range of nationalities is spread across Europe, in the UK, Ireland, France, Spain, Portugal, Hungary and the Netherlands.

We love to experiment and are currently working in quarterly cycles where the Product designer is a key contributor to the discovery phase, uncovering customer insights that lead to better prioritisation of the roadmap.

Problems we‚Äôre solving

With big ambitions come big problems. Here are some of the biggest challenges we face:

  • Organic growth. We have been growing organically by making our large inventory highly discoverable on Google and delivering a great experience for our customers. We will further invest in organic growth by continuing to optimise our site for SEO, creating content at scale, and making the customer journey seamless with performance and conversion rate optimisations.
  • Search and discoverability. With over 1 million listings added to our marketplace, we have to automate curation and improve our discovery experience to help customers find the perfect pieces that match their needs, tastes and budget. This ranges from improving inventory data quality at scale to crafting a better search experience and offering personalised recommendations.
  • Shopping experience. How do we help users choose the right item for them at the best price. With our large selection of inventory, we need to help the user to make that final decision to purchase on Vinterior. We strive to make that shopping experience as smooth and delightful as possible, solving the pain points for both buyers and sellers during that experience.
Our company values

Our interview process looks for people who share our company values:

  • Think Big
  • Keep Learning
  • Show Grit
  • Embrace Transparency
  • One Team
  • Show Customers the Love
  • Champion Sustainability

The more our values sound like you and describe people you‚Äôd enjoy working with, the more likely you‚Äôll thrive at Vinterior.

  • Take broad, conceptual ideas and shape them into something valuable that can be delivered by the squad.
  • Design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and meet our brand guidelines.
  • Contribute to uncovering what a great product design and development process looks like at Vinterior.
  • Help to raise awareness, understanding and appreciation of design at Vinterior.
  • Collaborate with other departments like Brand and SEO to offer a user experience that is both delightful and impactful.
  • Reporting to the CPO, you will provide design leadership within the product organisation and may also manage another product designer.

Requirements

  • 3-5+ years of professional experience as a product designer
  • An online portfolio which demonstrates your UX and visual design flair
  • Ability to own the design process end-to-end from conception to implementation.
  • Ability to plan and conduct user research and usability testing in a remote environment.
  • Demonstrated experience with end-to-end (UX and UI) product design for the web

  • Proficiency with design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch)
